It was He Who Walks Behind the Rows, and I did fall on my knees in terror and hide my eyes lest the fierceness of His face strike me dead. And He told me all that has since happened. He said, ‘Joseph has taken his things and fled this happy place because the worship of me is no more upon him. So take you his life, and spill his blood, but let not his flesh pollute the corn. Cast him instead upon the road.'

dialogues.speaker: GROUP
dialogues.text: Yea, and so it was done. Joseph the Unbeliever was cast upon the road

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PANS THE FACES of the group as they speak. They ar robots. Unquestioning. Fundamentalist. Future Moral Majoritarians. They listen raptly to their Ayatollah.  57.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: And He Who Walks Behind The Rows did say, 'I will send outlanders amongst you, a man and a woman, and these outlanders will be un- believers and profaners of the Holy, and the man shall sorely test you, for he has great power, even greater than The Blue Man. CAMERA PICKS UP The Blue Man on the crucifix, with its grotesquely jaunty cap. All eyes have turned to it. CAMER ZOOMS IN to its face as the ceremony continues.

dialogues.speaker: GROUP, (VO)
dialogues.text: The Blue Man. . .Yes. . .The Blue Man.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC, (VO)
dialogues.text: And we shall not fail Him, for He is the true God, the only God, and His message has been planted within us as the corn seed is put into the ground. (rising) Make sacrifice unto Him. Bring Him the blood of the Unbelievers 1 Malachai jumps to his feet and shouts in a killing fervor

dialogues.speaker: MALACHAT, (VO)
dialogues.text: Make sacrifice! The group, stirred by this, rises to its feet also.

dialogues.speaker: GROUP, (VO)
dialogues.text: Make sacrifice! Yes! They start their chanting again. The CAMERA is by now on a CLOSE-UP of The Blue Man's face It FILLS THE SCREEN, those bulging eyes staring out at us The humming grows in intensity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Job and Sarah are sitting on the dusty porch of the house where we first saw them (inside). They're still dressed i their costumes. They look like caricatures of two anachronistic, broken down aristocrats.  58.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Now what do we do?

dialogues.speaker: JOB
dialogues.text: I wanna get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: JOB
dialogues.text: Like Joseph.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: JOB
dialogues.text: Why not? If he can do it, so can we. Sarah leafs through a pile of manila paper she has next t her. She extracts one and hands it to Job.

dialogues.speaker: THE DRAWING
dialogues.text: It shows us, in Sarah's innocent style, what we DID NOT s happening to Joseph - Malachai (in stick figure) pulling oversized knife across the helpless boy's throat. A numbe other children watch gleefully. There is blood everywhere spewing out into the corn.

dialogues.speaker: TWO SHOT
dialogues.text: Job starts to whimper.

dialogues.speaker: JOB
dialogues.text: I don't like Malachai. I want my mommy and daddy!

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: They're gone, Jobie. They're in the corn.

dialogues.speaker: JOB
dialogues.text: It's not fair! I wish Isaac never came here!

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (resigned) He's always been here. Just like He Who Walks Behind The Rows.  59. They sit there on the edge of the porch, legs dangling ov the side, Job pouting and Sarah contemplating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another old and weather-beaten sign. It reads: YOU ARE NO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PULLS BACK to show the highway and the corn. The t bird ENTERS THE FRAME and we follow it down the road. We A BARN rising above the edge of the corn-field in the nea distance. Written on it in large, white letters is the legend: ONLY JESUS SAVES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicky is leaning against the door staring out the window. She looks haggard and beaten.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: We should’ve come this way the first time.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Would it have saved that old man? Burt looks at her, surprised by the question and concerne the tone.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Hopefully the police will be able to figure that out. They drove for a moment. Vicky begins to giggle. Burt loo at her with even more concern. The giggle is a stream tha turns into a river. She presses her hand to her mouth, trying to suppress a hysterical laughter, a laughter of catharsis and relief.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: What are you laughing at?

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Did you see those signs? The ones on the side of the road? Gales of laughter now.  60.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: There! There are some more. Slow down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They border the right side of the road. There's a single word stenciled on each wooden "board. The entire set read

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicky's laughter is subsiding, but slowly. She's had a mu needed belly laugh. Burt doesn't really think it's funny, he's glad Vicky does.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: (wiping tears) They only forgot one thing.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: "Burma Shave."

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: Honey, are you sure you're alright? She finally stops laughing, but dabs her eyes with a tiss

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: I will be. Just as soon as we're a thousand miles from here in sunny, sinful California with the Rocky Mountains between us and all this. (beat) Look, here are some more.

dialogues.speaker: THE CAR
dialogues.text: Breasting a hill. Gatlin appears in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Vicky and Burt get their first glimpse of the town.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: Looks like a swingin' place.  61. EXT. GiATLIN - BURT & VICKY'S POV - DAY We get our first full glimpse of the town. It's in a dip the bottom of a hill. There's ONE MAIN STREET, a few cros streets, A PARK in the center and a few dusty elms. Just sleepy little town dozing in the summer sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt and Vicky are checking out the town. There's a quiet tense apprehension about it that they share.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Looks like The Twilight Zone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car is cruising at a moderate speed. It passes a few residential side streets. The houses are American Gothic wooden, white paint, porches - but nothing moves. So it seems. There are no cars, trucks, bicycles, people; no ki playing stickball or retired farmers smoking corncob pipe their porches.

dialogues.speaker: A HOUSE
dialogues.text: What Burt and Vicky don't see, however, are eyes that are upon them. A FACE, watching from an attic window, disappe behind a lace curtain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car now passes a BRICK BUILDING. This sign on the yellowed, patchy, front door reads: PUBLIC LIBRARY. With luck it contains 500 books. TWO BOYS rise slowly froma crouched position by the side of it. They watch the passi t-bird intently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is old, dusty, and locked up. Bags of feed and fertili are piled high. FIVE CHILDREN, three males and two female stare through the window. THEIR POV - THE STREET - DAY The thunderbird rolls by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt and Vicky are feeling more and more apprehensive. There's obviously something wrong here. Burt is going ver slowly, almost reluctant to proceed further into this pla  62.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: I guess nobody told them we were coming.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: I hope not.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: Ah, hell, they're probably all out under a tent somewhere singing Praise The Lord. Vicky isn't convinced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car slows to a stop in front of HAN SEN'S COFFEE SHOP scene of the opening carnage. Like every other place in t town, it looks empty and deserted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt and Vicky are checking it out.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: Let's see if there's a phone.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Unless a ghost is using it. Unlike when we last saw it, there is no sign of what went here. All of the tables and chairs are set up, the booths clean and the counter spotless. The only thing lacking is any sign of recent use.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Burt and Vicky enter. The door closing behind them muffles a sound from the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN
dialogues.text: A BLACK SLEEVED ARM reaches to a butcher block and picks CLEAVER.

dialogues.speaker: THE FRONT ROOM
dialogues.text: Burt is trying the pay phone with no luck. Vicky is looki at the CHALKBOARD on the counter. It says: TODAY’S SPECIA MEAT LOAF CORN FRITTERS MOM HANSEN’S HOMEMADE PIE $2.74. Vicky runs her finger along the counter and looks at the dust. Burt hangs up the receiver disgustedly.  63.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: Nothing. Not even a dial tone.

dialogues.speaker: PARKING LOT
dialogues.text: TwO BOYS sneak along the side of the car. They carry side and keep low, out of sight

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt and Vicky are about to leave when they hear a NOISE the kitchen. Burt starts towards the kitchen door but Vic grabs him.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Burt! Please! Don't go in there.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: Why not? It might be somebody.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Please! Something's wrong. I can feel it. I've been feeling it ever since we got here. Let's just get in the car. Now. We'll drive to Hemingford. Or Grand Island. Anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: Vicky, you're really spooked. Come on, take it easy.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Please. Humor me. TI don't want you to go in there! The urgency in her voice, her insistence, wins him.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: Alright. But at least let's look around some more. There's got to be somebody. And just as they turn towards the front door, Burt spots two "somebodys" messing with the car. They've got the doo open and are trying to sneak in.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: Hey! Get away from that car!  64.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys, both around 12, dart off, leaving the door open Burt dashes out after them, several steps ahead of Vicky, isn't quick enough to catch them

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: See that? Just like "back home. Leave your car for two minutes and look what happens. He hurries back to the driver's side and gets in.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: Get in. I don't want to lose them. She follows him into the car quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It lurches forward in the direction the boys ran.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: What are you going to do when you catch them?

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: Ask them where I can find some help. What else? (beat) Damn! Where'd they go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no sign of the boys. No sign of anyone. Up ahead see the main part of town. There's a REXALL, a FIVE & DIM the GRACE BAPTIST CHURCH with its towering steeple, and n to that, the three-story GATLIN MUNICIPAL BUILDING.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: (nervous) Look, we're already in the car. Why don't we just continue on to Hemingford. It'll take us twenty minutes.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: But we've found people.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Yeah. A couple of kids who tried to break into our car.  Burt debates.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: There is something strange about this place. After the way the old man acted...

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: And what happened to him. The thought chills her.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: Maybe you're right. We might be better off in a larger town anyway. He makes a U-turn in the middle of the street and starts heading out of town. Something stops him OFF SCREEN.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: Over there!

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: I saw a door open and close. That house.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: I didn't see anything.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: Let's check it out.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Why? I thought we were going.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: Yeah, but if we know somebody's here....

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: We don't know anything. I was looking over there. I didn't see it.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: Vick...Settle down. This is not a lab experiment, we don’t need all the answers... He starts driving towards the house. 65.  66.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Don't patronize me, Burt.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: I'm not. I saw the door swing open. A quick look. It can't hurt. Vicky doesn't answer him. They pull up in front of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt is up the steps to the porch in two bounds. Vicky ta longer. She's nervous and sullen. Only a SCREEN DOOR separates them from the inside. Burt shouts through it.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: Hello? Anybody home? He bangs on the frame a few times.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: Hello? We've had an accident. we'd like to use your telephone.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: You see? I told you. Now can we go? Burt frowns. He pauses for a beat, then opens the door an pokes his head in.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Burt! This is somebody's house!

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: Precisely. And all we want to do is use their phone. He enters the house. Reluctantly, Vicky follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a living room off to the left, a dining room to t right, and a staircase straight ahead. Other rooms are in back.

dialogues.speaker: THEIR POV
dialogues.text: What isn't broken or cracked is worn, torn or faded. The upholstery on the couch in the living room looks as if someone took a knife to it  67. The stuffing has been gouged out of the seat. A cracked picture frame hangs lopsidedly over it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt and Vicky look at each other. Neither likes the feel about this place.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: I’1l check the back. CAMERA FOLLOWS BURT behind the staircase and into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In disrepair and disuse, like the rest of the house, it d contain one item of interest to Burt. A TELEPHONE. He gra the receiver and raises it, but never gets a chance to di

dialogues.speaker: THE WIRE
dialogues.text: Cut. It dangles uselessly from the receiver.

dialogues.speaker: FOYER
dialogues.text: Vicky watches as Burt walks out holding the useless phone with its severed wire.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: I found a phone.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Well, it certainly goes with the decor.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: Back door was open too. Whoever I saw must've slipped out. Probably one of those kids I chased off.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Who else would avoid us! I mean, it's not like we've got a body in the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: Now, now.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Why don't we sit down and make ourselves comfortable. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VICKY(cont'd) I'm sure nobody'1ll mind if we pour the first drinks. Then when the City Council shows up....

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: Okay, I surrender. We're going. He moves towards the front door under her triumphant star conceding tacitly her right to be annoyed. They're about leave when A FLOORBOARD CREAKS above, They hear it and FR simultaneously.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Don't you dare. Burt is like a puppy who's spied a squirrel up in a tree. thinks he has. He shushes her, his eyes never leaving the ceiling as he moves towards the staircase.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Burt! This is ridiculous! I'm getting really angry.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: (whispering) Come on, Vick! Don't you want to know who it is? Why they're hiding from us? This whole thing is so bizarre.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: (shouting whisper ) All the more reason to get out now! Burt is already walking up the stairs. Very slowly and quietly, his eyes constantly on the landing above. Vicky pouts and sulks and sighs and fidgets at the bottom, know she's unable to stop him. His curiosity is contagious as as she'd like to deny it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt slinks up the staircase like a cat stalking an unsuspecting bird. ANOTHER NOISE, FOLLOWED BY FOOT-STEPS. stops and looks at Vicky.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: As her eyes meet Burt’s. Someone is sneaking around up there. They both know it, but Vicky fears it more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt gets to the first landing. He checks ahead -the stai now reverse direction - then looks back at Vicky one last time. He is visibly more tense now. He's starting to swea and his breath quickens. He takes a step forward, and cre a floorboard himself. It freezes him to the spot. After a beat, he continues.

dialogues.speaker: UPSTAIRS
dialogues.text: TwO BEDROOMS and a BATHROOM are visible. A SHORT STAIRCAS leads up to a MASTER BEDROOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt steps on another loose board. It CREAKS VERY LOUDLY. Anybody waiting for him has to know where he is by that o He sucks in a breath. MORE FOOTSTEPS FROM ABOVE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt is at the top landing between the two bedrooms. He l into one of them, then disappears into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We recognize from the bed and bulletin board that this is bedroom Sarah was sick in three years ago when her father on the phone with her mother, x just before he was murder Only now, on that bulletin board, are tacked ALL OF THE PICTURES we've thus seen of her" stick figure prophesies. The bedroom looks like it hasn't been used in a long time at least cleaned, and is dusty and full of cobwebs, but t crayon drawings on the manila paper are a child's illustrations of the nightmare that took over Gatlin.

dialogues.speaker: THE DRAWINGS
dialogues.text: Burt studies the drawings. He is seeing them for the firs time and they chill him to the marrow. He rips off the rendition of HE WHO WALKS BEHIND THE ROWS and stares at i

dialogues.speaker: THE PICTURE
dialogues.text: As Burt stares at it. The evil figure stares back out at him.

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Just as Burt turns out of the doorway, he comes face to f with. . . . . Vicky!!! Each jumps and gasps at the same time, their hearts racking and their eyes widening.  70. Before they have a chance to rebuke each other, another N FROM UPSTAIRS. They look towards the master bedroom and n in silent agreement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get to the top of the short staircase and are about look into the master bedroom, in fact are craning their n and gripping each other with white knuckles from the tens when a TREMENDOUS, HORRIFIC SHRIEK scares the daylights o of them.

dialogues.speaker: HAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA. . .WIPE OUT
dialogues.text: Vicky loses it. She screams before she can realize that i a record as the MUSIC of the oldie WIPE OUT, continues playing. Burt charges into the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt stops dead in his tracks, finding himself staring do an equally frightened and surprised Sarah. Vicky enters t bedroom a BEAT later. Burt begins to laugh. Vicky joins h They laugh almost as hard as Vicky did in the car when sh saw the signs outside Gatlin, but they stop themselves wh they realize how frightened the child is.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Don't be afraid. we didn't mean to scare you. Sarah is staring at them like they're from another planet She warms to Vicky, though.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Well hello! What a darling little girl. What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (sheepish) Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Sarah. That's a lovely name. I'm Vicky, and this is Burt. Sarah won't look at Burt. She steals a glance at Vicky.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: Are you alone here, Sarah? She doesn't answer.  71.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Do you live here? Sarah shakes her head no.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: You just come here to play? Sarah looks down at the floor. Her record finishes and sh takes it off the turntable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt notices the manila paper and crayons next to her, registering the connection to the terrible pictures he's seen. He says nothing for the moment.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Are your mommy and daddy around, Sarah? Sarah answers as if that's a stupid question, but the tho of the answer saddens her anyway.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: They're in the cornfield.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: What are they doing there?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: All the grownups are there.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: Well, are they working? Or are they having some kind of meeting?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (frustrated, a little frightened) Noooo! Isaac put them there!

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: Isaac? Who's Isaac? Sarah shrugs defensively. She doesn't want to answer.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Tell us who Isaac is, darling.  72.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Our leader. Now Burt is getting frustrated and a little impatient.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: Leader of what?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Of everybody. Burt throws up his hands and walks over to the window. He had enough of this conversation, and frankly so have I. V keeps at it with Sarah, turning even sweeter and more pat in the wake of Burt's reaction.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Could you take us to Isaac?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (very grave) Uhhhh-uhhhh.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: While the conversation continues in the B.G. we watch as looks out the window and sees something that bewilders hi

dialogues.speaker: VICKY, (VO)
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: That same, immense, invisible force we saw in the cornfie just before Chester Diehl was killed is now moving toward the town. The corn is shaking wildly and the sky darkens tremendous rate. A HOWLING WIND accompanies this. It soun ALIVE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks away for a second, blinking his eyes in disbelie

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (VO)
dialogues.text: He's scary! Burt looks out at the cornfield after his momentary respi

dialogues.speaker: VICKY, (VO)
dialogues.text: (to Sarah) (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VICKY(cont'd) Sarah, it's very important that we speak to some grownups as soon as possible. Is there anyone around that you can think of?

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Nothing. No sign of what Burt saw a moment ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt rubs his eyes and accepts the possibility that stres getting to him. He walks back to Vicky.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: They're gone.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Gone where?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Into the corn! Burt intervenes.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: We're not getting anywhere with this, Vick.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Give her a chance, honey. She keeps saying the townspeople are out in the cornfield. (to Sarah) Right, sweetheart? All of the grownups are in the corn? Sarah nods affirmatively. There is a chilling quality to innocence with which she does this.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: I tell you what, then. You stay here with her. I want to go look in that municipal building.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: (alarmed) Why?  74.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: Why? Because we've got a double murder to report and we're standing here with a pint sized version of Catherine the Great trying to make sense out of what happened to all the people in this town.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: I just thought she could help us.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: I know. Maybe you're right. She's all we have for the moment anyway. At least let's not lose track of her.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Alright. Maybe somebody will come for her.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: If they do, you just bring them over to the car and hit the horn. I'll keep an eye open. He kisses her lightly and heads for the door. The reality his departure suddenly makes Vicky nervous.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Burt?...Do you think it's...safe? A beat. Burt isn't sure, but he doesn't want to scare her

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: For who?

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: For either of us?

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: Yeah. Weird, but safe. He smiles, and is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt closes the front door, the wooden one behind the scr and makes sure it's locked securely. He gets into the car  75.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Burt walks towards the center of town, checking everywher for signs of people. The sidewalks are empty, storefronts dark and silent. There's no one to be seen anywhere. Only sense at Burt being followed.

dialogues.speaker: STALKERS POV
dialogues.text: CAMERA TRACKS Burt ACROSS THE PARK in the center of town. see THE POND in the middle of this park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The solitary car passes the Grace Baptist Church. Cornshu have been heaped in the doorway. The letters in the front sign haven't changed for three years. They read CORN DROU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the car goes by, A PREGNANT TEENAGE WOMAN steps out of shadows and glares at it. She hurries inside. This RACHEL DEIGAN.

dialogues.speaker: BURT BEING FOLLOWED
dialogues.text: Burt turns to look behind him, CAMERA hides as Burt turns onto the main drag and studies the buildings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wares are displayed "but we can barely see them for the d on the window. Something has been written in the dirt.

dialogues.speaker: WINDOW
dialogues.text: The message: HE WHO WALKS BEHIND THE ROWS SEETH ALL

dialogues.speaker: GATLIN REXALL
dialogues.text: The next building over. Cornshucks and corn leaves have b piled in the doorway and inside the display cases. ANGLE — THE CAR It continues its Stygian journey.

dialogues.speaker: FAVORING GATLIN GRADE SCHOOL
dialogues.text: He passes the Gatlin Grade School. HE MOVES UP THE STEPS INSIDE.  76.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APPROACHING THE BLACKBOARD from the door, we see A CORNCO CRUCIFIX hanging in the center of the black-board. Underneath, in chalk, is written: I HAVE WITHDRAWN MY HAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt pulls up in front of the building. He climbs the ste to a pair of WOODEN DOORS. There's A DRIFT OF CORN HUSKS the top step and another CORNCOB CRUCIFIX hung on each of doors. Burt looks at these thoughtfully for a moment growing more grim by the second. He goes inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah is sitting on the floor, Vicky on the bed. Vicky tr to calm herself by calming Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Well, I guess it's just you and me. Sarah smiles at her. She is a lot less nervous than Vicky

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: So tell me, what were you doing here all by yourself? Just playing records? Sarah balks, tugs at her dress.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Ah, come on. You can tell me. Sarah looks at her, wondering if she can trust her, then gives in. She points to her paper and crayons.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Drawing? What's so secret about that?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Not supposed to.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: You're not supposed to draw?  77. Sarah nods affirmative.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Says who? Isaac? A negative shake of the head from Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Malachai.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Malachai? Now who's....Never mind. I tell you what. You draw me a picture and we'll just not tell Malachai, or Isaac, or anyone at all. How about it?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (brightening) Okay. She arranges the paper and crayons and begins drawing. Sh so sweet and adorable that Vicky can hardly take her eyes of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt pushes through the doors and steps into the LOBBY of building. What we see is not what he sees. We see, briefl scene from three years ago.

dialogues.speaker: A LARGE ROOM
dialogues.text: off of which are several doors, all with frosted glass an black lettering. One says: BUREAU OF REGISTRATION, anothe is: DEEDS and a third says: DOG OFFICER. In the back is a SIGN that designates: RESTROOMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is lively and full of people. THE MUNICIPAL WORK of Gatlin, country folks in casual attire, are crowded ar A TRIO OF YOUNG CHILDREN who are handing out LEMONADE, an charging quarters for it. The kids have brought a PORTABL STAND into the room, complete with pitchers, ice and a si and a cup for change, and the adults are finding themselv amused and refreshed.  78. It takes a moment for the deadly poison in the drink to t effect, and as the shocked and confused people are trying figure out what's happening to them, AN OLDER GROUP of TEENAGERS, led by Malachai, charge in with their slaughte weapons. They cut their helpless victims down mercilessly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RESTROOM DOOR opens and POLICE CHIEF BILL HOTCHKISS c out straightening his belt. He sees the carnage and freez So do the murderers. They hadn't expected this. Hotchkiss dumbfounded and horrified, but he has the presence of min flee just as a half dozen of the demonic kids leap out at with their weapons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malachai expertly throws a knife after the police chief, Hotchkiss has slammed shut the door. The knife buries its in the wood.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: As he scans the quiet, empty room. There are no bodies, b the place is a shambles. Desks, chairs and tables are overturned, filing cabinets are down, and everywhere is C dried, brittle and yellowed with age.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt passes a BULLETIN BOARD upon which are several notic Prominent among them is one that advertises: OLD FASHIONE

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: As he reads this, something flashes in his mind.

dialogues.speaker: QUICK FLASH
dialogues.text: to Sarah's drawing of the revival meeting in the corn whe the child usurper (Isaac) shoved the minister aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt turns away and goes to the door marked BUREAU OF REGISTRATION. He begins to open it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house in which are Vicky and Sarah. A BLACK HAT COMES INTO FRAME, and then the body of the BOY wearing it. He i dressed in the black, cloth uniform we have seen. CAMERA WIDENS TO INCLUDE more than A DOZEN COMPANIONS. They are oldest boys we have seen, between 15 and 18 years old, an some of them are pretty big. All of them are scary. They have a hungry, lethal glint in their eyes. They've formed big semi-circle around Malachai, and they're humming thei weird song as they close in. All are armed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt is exploring the office. It's a shambles, like the other room, and corn is heaped everywhere in here too.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: He takes all this in with growing bewilderment. Then helo up at the far wall and we see his eyes widen with surpris

dialogues.speaker: THE WALL
dialogues.text: It's dominated by the strangest PORTRAIT OF CHRIST we've seen. We know it's Christ but even so, there's a stronger resemblance to Lon Chaney in "The Phantom Of The Opera." Christ is grinning and he has green hair but, after a mom we see it really isn't hair at all but rather corn plants

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt crosses the room to the picture and takes it off the wall, standing on a chair to do so. He stares at the hide corruption for a moment and then smashes it on the floor. isn't out of control, but the image has affected and offe him deeply. He heads for the door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA LINGERS on the window as Burt exits. Slowly, one b one, THREE BOYS, all crowned in BLACK RIMMED HATS, look i us and scan the now vacant office. They hold a brief, whispered conversation and then duck OUT OF VIEW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shadows are beginning to fall across Gatlin as the sun is getting low.  80. The ominous circle of boys moving towards the house has broken up into two's and three's. A few are at the front door, which is locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two more find a basement window ajar and wriggle in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another group applies a crowbar to a living room window.

dialogues.speaker: HOUSE
dialogues.text: Sarah is still working on her picture. Vicky enters from another room.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: How's it coming?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (innocent, angelic) You.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: (delighted) Oh! Can I see?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Yes. She finishes a couple of strokes and hands the picture to Vicky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her face goes from bemused to horrified to repelled as sh looks at the picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can tell from Sarah's expectant face that she has absolutely no idea that what she's drawn is bad in any wa Vicky is about to rebuke her when we hear the sound of GL BREAKING. Vicky whips around and looks out the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt climbs the stairs to the THIRD FLOOR. He's tired, sweating heavily, and beaten. He pulls the door open and exits into a dark corridor.

dialogues.speaker: CORRIDOR WALL
dialogues.text: PAINTED IN RED along the wall, which ends at a FIRE ESCAP DOOR, are the words: THUS LET THE INIQUITOUS BE CUT DOWN THE TRUE GOD MIGHT COME FORTH Burt follows the words alon the wall, arriving at a pair of OFFICES on either side. O belonged to POLICE CHIEF BILL HOTCHKISS (The Blue Man) an the other to MAYOR JOHN D. REESE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt turns into the police chief's office and gets a frig

dialogues.speaker: BURT'S POV
dialogues.text: A MOLDY SCARECROW, festooned with corn, is propped up in chair behind the desk. A POLICEMAN'S BADGE is pinned on t cloth shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicky comes out of the bedroom and stops at the top of th stairs.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: (anxious, tentative) Burt? Is that you? She walks down the short staircase. The answer, at first, silence. Then, softly, the humming. Vicky listens, and clutches in her right hand the picture Sarah drew. Curios gets the better of her. Ever so slowly, she tiptoes down the top of the second landing and looks down.

dialogues.speaker: THE FIRST FLOOR
dialogues.text: The humming gets louder. The Children Of The Corn begin t congregate at the bottom of the stairs. They stare at Vic through rabid eyes. Their weapons and their intent are plainly visible.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: (shouts) Who are you?  82. They hum steadily. Vicky shouts even louder. She's terrified.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: What do you want? The humming stops abruptly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malachai steps forward from the rear. He looks up at Vick with a blissed-out expression.

dialogues.speaker: MALACHAL
dialogues.text: We want to give you peace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicky figures that one out in a hurry. She lunges back upstairs, tripping and stumbling in her haste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malachai lets slip his pups of war.

dialogues.speaker: MALACHAL
dialogues.text: Seize her! And with a gleeful shout, the boys rush the stairs all at once. They fall over each other in their haste to do Malachai's bidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicky runs into the bedroom SCREAMING AT THE TOP OF HER LUNGS. She slams the door and frantically pulls a CHEST O DRAWERS against it just as the first wave of boys arrives Their initial charge is dulled by the unexpected weight o the furniture, but it is obvious they won't be stopped. Vicky, still screaming, pushes against the door with all might. A HATCHET blasts through, cutting her arm and splintering the wood. Vicky screams again and clutches at arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door gives way and the boys, like giant black rats, p into the room. Vicky picks up a lamp and throws it at the Sarah remains seated on the floor, frozen, staring fearfu at the proceedings.  83.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH'S POV
dialogues.text: Vicky is dragged, literally, kicking and screaming from t room. Her clothes are torn, she's bleeding from the mouth arm and her face is badly bruised. She has dropped the crumpled picture on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah is left untouched and alone in the room. She hasn't moved through the whole thing. Her wide, terror-stricken tell the whole story. He lip trembles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt is still there, trying to figure the foreboding scarecrow, but has decided he's had enough of trying to figure anything in Gatlin. He turns around and sees a picture on the wall behind him.

dialogues.speaker: THE PICTURE
dialogues.text: It's the VIRGIN MARY, withering back from the onslaught o monstrous DRAGON. Underneath is a caption: AND WHEN THE

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: As he reads the caption, he senses something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He begins to move on, but something about this picture pu at him. He stares at it again.

dialogues.speaker: THE PICTURE
dialogues.text: His eyes study the dragon, and then the woman, and then t threatening dragon again....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then Burt begins to run. He flies out the door and in the....

dialogues.speaker: CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Running as fast as his legs can carry him, slipping on th slick floor....  84.

dialogues.speaker: THE STAIRCASE
dialogues.text: He "takes the stairs three at a time, two flights, and bu through the doors to the main lobby.

dialogues.speaker: THE LOBBY
dialogues.text: Burt streaks across it and crashes through the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first thing Burt sees stops him momentarily.

dialogues.speaker: THUNDERBIRD
dialogues.text: It's wrecked; slashed, battered, the hood is up and the w ripped out; and the engine is stuffed with corn husks and plants. Burt enters frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt bolts down the stairs and past the car at a dead run His path is a trip in time. Various buildings he runs pas give us a brief glimpse of their terrible history.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt runs past the library.

dialogues.speaker: QUICK FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: A GROUP OF "CHILDREN" are burning its books in a big bonf outside. DOZENS OF BOOKS are tossed out the windows by th inside while the ones outside heap them on the flames. IS supervises.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: He doesn't see this flashback, of course, but instead kee running. His footsteps and the steady sound of his breath are the only things we hear. He passes the REXALL.

dialogues.speaker: THE CHURCH
dialogues.text: As Burt runs past the church, we see another scene of hor

dialogues.speaker: QUICK FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: The minister is being manhandled by Malachai and ANOTHER GROUP. They have already beaten and bloodied him. Now the roughly put a noose around his neck. He pleads with them vain. They shove him out of the bell tower and he plummet until the thick rope catches, snapping his neck.  85. He hangs there with his eyes bulging and his tongue stick out, just like in Sarah's drawing.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: He remembers the drawing and stops for a beat to look up the steeple. The rope still hangs but the noose is empty. Burt gulps at the air and continues on.

dialogues.speaker: THE PARK
dialogues.text: Cutting through the park, Burt leaps over THE POND.

dialogues.speaker: THE POND
dialogues.text: A DOLL floats face down in the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And finally, Burt arrives at the house. He sees the broke windows and kicked-in front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt nearly rips the screen door off its hinges, smashes the door. He looks around wildly, very much out of breath

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: He runs up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt charges in, wild eyed and maniacal. The sight that greets him is Sarah, who is shaking and whimpering in the corner. A LINE OF BLOOD shows where Vicky was dragged out the room. Burt kneels next to the little girl.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: Where is she? Where have they taken her??? Please I Sarah is severely traumatized at the moment. She looks at Burt blankly.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: (pleading) If you have any idea you've got to tell me. She's in danger. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BURT(cont 'd) She could be your mother. Please! Please! The urgency in his voice, perhaps that last line, reaches something in Sarah. She surfaces briefly.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Malachai....

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: Who? Malachai? Where do I find him. Sarah stares at him for a moment, then looks over to the crumpled picture Vicky dropped just before she was taken. Burt grabs it and uncrumples it.

dialogues.speaker: THE PICTURE
dialogues.text: Just like all of Sarah's other drawings, in crayon, it sh an obvious likeness of Vicky - same clothes and hairstyle although in stick figure - crucified on a cross in the cornfield. There is blood dripping from several wounds including the one we saw her get in the arm. We cannot te if the Vicky in the pic-ture is dead or alive.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: As he reacts to the picture.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSEUP. Vicky is lying on something, flat on her back somewhere in the cornfield. It's a large clearing. She is only semi-conscious. Bruised and bloody, she drifts in an out of awareness. She seems to be hearing voices, which w also hear.

dialogues.speaker: MALACHAI, (VO)
dialogues.text: Does He speak to you, Isaac?

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC, (VO)
dialogues.text: He speaks to me always, but today He is displeased. Vicky isn't sure whether this is just a bad dream. She to her head from side to side, trying to awaken herself.  87.

dialogues.speaker: MALACHAI
dialogues.text: We now see that this is indeed no dream. The two are ther with her.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: He is displeased with you Malachai.

dialogues.speaker: MALACHAL
dialogues.text: (nervous) What have I done?

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: (angry) oo Question Him not in vain! Do you not know you did sacrifice Joseph without an offering? Did you not spill the blood of the old man when his oil and gasoline were still useful to us?

dialogues.speaker: MALACHAL
dialogues.text: We have our own fuel now. In the still. From the corn.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Shew not your pride, Malachai. We have not enough.

dialogues.speaker: MALACHAL
dialogues.text: (vindictive) And is the Lord not displeased that we have not offered Him Sarah and Job?

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Sarah has the gift of Sight! She warned us of the coming of the interlopers. Question not my judgment, Malachai. I am the giver of his word. Malachai glowers at Isaac. For the first time, we see him unafraid of the younger boy, even a bit scorn-ful and resentful.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: She struggles to open her eyes and see where the voices a coming from.  88.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC, (VO)
dialogues.text: Now go you and bring me the hus- band. VJe must offer them tonight. When Amos leaves us. Vicky suddenly feels herself being pulled, jerked, up int the air. She snaps out of her daze enough to see what is going on around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is being raised into the air. She sees Isaac below, a the departing Malachai. There are several other CHILDREN around, helping with the erecting of her cross. Only now does she realize that she is tied to a large, WOODEN CRUCIFIX. It is turned as it's raised, and she finds herself....

dialogues.speaker: VICKY'S POV
dialogues.text: ...face to face with The Blue Man.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Her horror and revulsion are too intense even for a screa She presses back as hard as she can against the cross, ba away from her fate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt is running - along a wall of the corn, frantically screaming for Vicky. He is hot, tired and out of breath. is also intensely determined. He rips the corn plants out the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt is lost, or at least he doesn't know where to begin. All he knows is that Vicky may be out here somewhere, undergoing some unspeakable torture. He tries another direction.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: He's pressing his way through another row. The corn seems have thickened, as if Burt was at the bottom of a giant green pool. There are no longer discernible rows, just on giant wall of corn.  89.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plants themselves are beginning to resist Burt physically. Leaves swat him in the face. One cuts him wit its razor edge. A stalk bends over in his path, wrapping itself around him. Burt is getting panicky, but mentally fighting the idea that this stuff has a will of its own. finally loosens the tenacious stalk.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ! He struggles on, sure of only one thing. His will to find Vicky. And then he spots something that may help him.

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH STEEPLE
dialogues.text: He spots the highest place in Gatlin, from where he can l out over the entire cornfield.

dialogues.speaker: EDGE OF THE FIELD
dialogues.text: Burt emerges from the corn, fighting his way to the very last. He is plastered with plants - leaves, silk, husks - and is bloody and exhausted. He tears the stuff off of hi He finds himself next to a BARN, and decides to check it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is quite large, made out of wood, and painted red. THE DOORS ARE OPEN so Burt approaches carefully. There is no sign of anyone about.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: Someone is watching Burt as he walks towards the barn. He still brushing corn plants off himself. The watcher makes move towards him, but keeps pas with him at a distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt pokes his head in to make sure no one is there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same POV as Burt's, but three years ago. At first we thin this is what Burt is seeing, just as in the Municipal Building, but we will quickly realize it is from the past Police Chief Hotchkiss - sweating, disheveled and out of breath - is alone in the barn.  90. He looks at A PAGE FROM A BOOK very briefly, then stuffs piece of paper in his shirt pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes to a STILL which is housed in the barn. Next to i are SEVERAL 500 GALLON METAL CONTAINERS marked GASOHOL. H finds some HOSES, cuts off the metal ring fastners at the ends and connects them to the spigot on one of the drums. He's starting to unwind the hose out of the barn when...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, he's jumped by SEVERAL TEENAGE BOYS. They beat unconscious with ax handles, but not until after a fierce struggle. During the melee, his shirt is ripped and the piece of paper falls to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After the boys have dragged their unconscious victim away figure steps into the barn and picks up the paper. It is Job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt looks around. He sees the gasohol drums, the still, FAIRLY MODERN TRACTOR, and basic FARM IMPLEMENTS. But no Vicky. He heads to the church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt is nearing the church.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: Again we see Burt through the eyes of whomever is stalkin him, maintaining that careful, respectful distance. Burt starts to go in the front, then thinks better of it and w around the side. We follow Burt from THIS POV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt creeps up the back steps to the church and listens a the door for a beat, then tries the handle. It's open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt enters from behind the pulpit. He walks along a narr CORRIDOR, stops, and looks into the sanctuary.

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH SANCTUARY
dialogues.text: The same place Burt is looking at, only three years prior The gray haired MINISTER, whom we saw depicted in one of Sarah's drawings and also later hanged from the steeple, kneeling in prayer at the pulpit. Isaac, Malachai and the cohorts walk up behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Minister is unafraid at this moment. He has "been reading from his BIBLE, and rises and turns on the Childr with a defiant stare. He turns the book around and holds up to Isaac.

dialogues.speaker: THE BIBLE
dialogues.text: It is open to THE BOOK OF REVELATIONS. A page is missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isaac holds out his hand and Malachai hurries to fetch hi ANOTHER BIBLE. Isaac opens this one to the corre-sponding page and reads for a beat. He looks up at the Minister, w says something to him which we do not hear. Whatever it i Isaac sneers at the older man. He takes something out of pocket and holds it up for the Minister.

dialogues.speaker: THE POLICE CHIEF'S BADGE
dialogues.text: Unmistakably the real thing. It says: CHIEF OF POLICE and the bottom: GATLIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Minister is shaken. Isaac rips the page out of the Bi and crumples it, dropping it to the floor. The Minister b up, but the Children of the Corn are upon him. We've alre seen what happened next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first thing Burt sees is the destruction, even more vandalism than in the Municipal Building. The ICONS have been chipped, broken and painted upon; slogans have been painted on the walls in red: AND YE SHALL WORSHIP NO FALS GODS BEFORE HIM and AND A CHILD SHALL LEAD THEM; cornshoc and plants have been heaped everywhere; and THE CHRIST FI has been completely redone in corn - a crown of corn, cornsilk for hair, etc.  92.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And much to Hurt's surprise, there are PEOPLE. He hides i the shadows. A CEREMONY is taking place. Rachel Deigan, t pregnant girl who watched Burt drive by on his way to the Municipal Building, is there with her TWO YOUNG CHILDREN. Behind them, filling the first few pews, are a DOZEN ONLOOKERS, none of whom are older than 18. They are all watching as AMOS DEIGAN, a dark-haired boy of 19, is made ready for a very special occasion. He seems almost in a trance, and gives his wife a blissful, unseeing smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BLACK ROBED GIRL steps up to him and offers him a COB- HANDLED KNIFE and a BOWL hollowed out of another cob. Dei takes these and makes an incision in his chest, over his heart. He begins to draw a PENTAGRAM.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: He is alternately fascinated, horrified and revolted by w he sees. He is hardly able to restrain himself from stopp Amos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amos finishes the last line of the symbol. He hands the g back the knife and begins squeezing his blood into the bo When he has SEVERAL TABLESPOONS, the girl wipes the wound hands him a QUILL PEN and a SCROLL. She holds the scroll unfurled while he dips the pen in his blood and writes something down. The girl takes the pen and the scroll awa when he's done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deigan then turns to his family. The congregation begins hum as he offers the bowl to his wife. She tastes it with hesitation, then prepares to give some to the children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At that point, Burt can stand it no longer. He jumps out from his hiding place.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: No! He continues forward, stopping only at the edge of the pulpit.  93.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: Are you out of your minds??? What the hell do you think you're doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is dead silent. Everyone stares at him with hate eyes, everyone except Amos. He is too blissed out. He giv Burt the same vacant look he gave his wife.

dialogues.speaker: AMOS
dialogues.text: Today's my birthday.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: You've got a pretty sick way of celebrating, it. He turns on Rachel. He has suddenly assumed the role of a reproachful parent.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: And you! Are these your children? You ought to be locked up for even allowing them to see this much less.... The black robed girl shouts at him.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Silence, interloper! Your presence does profane this holy place. He will reckon with you I

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: Well that's fine, whoever "he" is. I happen to be a doctor. Maybe "he'd" like to discuss the medical ramifications of carving yourself up with an unsanitary object not to mention what it would do to those kids to drink it! Amos is confused. Someone is suddenly condemning what sho have been his hour of triumph.

dialogues.speaker: AMOS
dialogues.text: But it is as it should be. As it is written.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Speak you no more to him, Amos. He is an Unbeliever!  94. She looks to one of the boys in the pews.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Hurry. Bring Isaac...No, Malachai. The boy rushes out. Burt ignores this. He's making some progress with Amos.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: What do you mean, ‘As it is written? Written where? Amos looks at the scroll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scroll is resting on a ceremonial TABLE. The knife li next to it. Burt makes a move for the scroll just as the girl/priestess grabs for it. She gets the scroll first bu Burt gets her wrist. He is a different Burt now, a man wh has been pushed too far and is desperate. He twists her a forcefully and takes the scroll from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several of the OLDER BOYS in the congregation walk forwar Burt eyes them aggressively and they hesitate. He goes ba to the scroll.

dialogues.speaker: THE SCROLL
dialogues.text: He unfurls it, revealing a list of names, all written in blood like Amos'. The difference is that theirs are dried and brown, his is fresh red. Beside each name is a birthd and date of death. ZEPENIAH KIRK (GEORGE) B. OCT. 14, 196 OCT. 14, 1982 YEMEN HOLLIS, (EDWARD) B. JAN. 5, 1964 JAN.

dialogues.speaker: 5, 1983 MARY WELLS, (ROBERTA)
dialogues.text: and so on, until the last name, which is AMOS DEIGAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt looks at Amos in confusion.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: I don't understand. These kids all died so young?

dialogues.speaker: AMOS
dialogues.text: Not die. We go to Him, on the first night of our 19th year. Night is His time.  95.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: And what happens when you go to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BOY who ran out for Malachai bursts back in.

dialogues.speaker: BOY
dialogues.text: Malachai comes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl/priestess commands the others.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Seize him! Don't let him escape. Burt starts to back up as the emboldened youths surge forward. The girl picks up the ceremonial knife and plung it into Burt's right shoulder. He staggers backwards and falls into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PILE OF BIBLES. They are all open to a particular spot REVELATIONS - AND A PAGE HAS BEEN TORN OUT of each one at this spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt yanks the knife out of his shoulder, grimacing in pa The onrushing youths stop when he points the knife at the

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: (enraged) Is this your religion? He picks up one of the bibles with his left hand throws i them, and another and another, until he pauses once, noti the missing page.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: What did you do? Rip out the ten commandments, or just rearrange them to suit your needs? He rises to his feet, but staggers from pain and loss of blood. The boys inch forward. Burt stops again, threateni them with the knife. He backs out of the church...  96.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt exits the rear door....and begins to run. He tosses away the knife. After a BEAT, the hordes come running aft him. The girl/priestess is last, exhorting them.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Seize him! Don't let him escape

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: Whoever this is who has been stalking Burt watches him ru towards the main part of town. The stalker ducks away abruptly, hurrying himself to keep up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt is running through town. He turns down a side street only to find Malachai and his bunch running towards him. does an about face and heads the other way, narrowly. avoiding the group that chased him out of the church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt runs and runs, turning errantly whichever street or presents itself. Finally, he has to stop for breath. He quickly finds himself surrounded by a HALF DOZEN BOYS, al them armed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt stares them down, turning all around so that he can if and when any of them make their move. The boys are cautious. Burt is at least ten years older than the oldes of them, and he isn't any pushover. He is a wounded, desperate, adult and the boys sense this.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: I'm warning you guys. This isn't a game. First one of you comes near me's gonna get his head knocked off. CAMERA PANS THEIR FACES. These are children. The murder i their eyes is so incongruous with their physical selves t it is hard to imagine they are as deadly as we've seen th be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of them charges Burt and swings a sickle. Burt blocks and knees him in the groin.  97. As the boy doubles over, Burt pounds him between the shou blades, sending him to the ground. Burt will make ingenio use of his medical knowledge before this day is over. He picks up the sickle and swings it, just in time to send t more attackers scurrying backwards.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: God damn it! Now keep away from me! He walks towards them resolutely. They give ground, letti him pass. But just as he seems to be free...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malachai and his little Huns round the corner.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: Shit.... They explode after him, shouting and cheering in their killing frenzy. Burt takes off.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE MUNICIPAL BUILDING
dialogues.text: Burt shows some agility, wounded shoulder and all. He cat the bottom of the fire escape after a running leap which the tallest of his pursuers can match. Using his left han he pulls himself up and clatters up the metal stairs. He carries the sickle in his belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of the taller boys follow him, others stream around the front entrance. ANGLE - ROOF OF MUNICIPAL BLDG. Burt climbs to the roof from the top of the fire escape. runs across it and without stopping, jumps to

dialogues.speaker: THE ROOF OF THE REXALL
dialogues.text: ...the Rexall roof, and RIGHT INTO A PILE OF DECAYING, SKELETAL BODIES of the former adults of Gatlin. He lands first in the grisly mess. He gasps and swoons from the si and smell. He pauses until he hears the shouts behind him

dialogues.speaker: BURT'S POV
dialogues.text: Several of the OLDER AND LARGER BOYS, led by Malachai, ha reached the roof of the Municipal Building. They are runn towards the jump-gap.  98.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt notices that the ARMS AND LEGS of several of the bod around him are jutting up at strange angles. With several swift, angular strokes, he cuts a number of these into SH BONY SPIKES and points them towards where his pursuers wi be coming from. He lops a final HAND off at the wrist and positions the protruding bone.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: (to the corpse) Thanks for the hand. He runs to the edge of the Rexall roof. The only way off to jump, about 20 feet down. He looks back.

dialogues.speaker: BURT'S POV
dialogues.text: The first assault wave from the Municipal roof lands in t pile of bodies after clearing the jump. One boy falls squarely on one of the "spikes" and is im-paled. Malachai gets one through the leg, and falls in agony. Two other b however, land with no problem although they first run to check on Malachai.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt climbs over the edge of the Rexall roof and hangs as as he can before dropping. He falls into a tuck-and-roll, coming out of it with just a slightly sprained ankle. Suddenly, bottles, knives, rocks and other weapons begin rain down upon him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With glass breaking all around and the metal weapons stri the pavement by his feet, Burt hobbles away as fast as he can.

dialogues.speaker: REXALL ROOF
dialogues.text: The pursuers have already formed a "chain" and are loweri their horde to the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: STALKER'S POV
dialogues.text: The person who has been stalking Burt sees a new line of Children take up the pursuit. Burt heads to the left, and does the stalker.  99.

dialogues.speaker: BY A HOUSE
dialogues.text: Burt uses a 25-yard distance between him and the Huns to and gulp air. He's looking back, waiting for the first si of the demons when he hears something from above.

dialogues.speaker: UPPER WINDOW
dialogues.text: TwO GIRLS, dressed in drab, gray dresses, have opened the window above him and are pouring something out of a kettl towards him. ONE OF THEM IS PREGNANT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt dives out of the way, barely avoiding several gallon BOILING CORN OIL. He looks up at the girls in disbelief. They stare down at him in blind hatred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys are coming and it's time for Burt to flee. He ru past more houses. He's about to run back into the cornfie when somebody calls to him.

dialogues.speaker: JOB
dialogues.text: Hey Mister! Over here! The size, age and innocence of the boy stop Burt.

dialogues.speaker: JOB
dialogues.text: Still in his oversized suit, he's a comically absurd figu

dialogues.speaker: JOB
dialogues.text: C'mere! I know where to hide!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt looks back and sees the alternative. He decides to chance it and runs after the boy.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: JOB
dialogues.text: C'mon! They run into the backyard of the house next door. This i the house where Burt and Vicky first found Sarah.  100.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Job leads Burt to a pair of outside cellar doors, one of which is open. The little boy runs down them like the whi Rabbit. Burt follows like Alice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's danger here. It's dark and Burt's eyes are acclimated to the light. He sees Job reach up and close t door over them, then switch on a flashlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's another door at the bottom of the steps and an ol unused one adjacent to this. Job opens the latter one.

dialogues.speaker: STAIRWAY
dialogues.text: Job leads the way with his flashlight.

dialogues.speaker: JOB
dialogues.text: Careful. They walk down a short flight of creaky, wooden stairs towards a lighted room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the dim light of a KEROSENE LAMP, Burt finds himself i homemade bomb shelter. It is a 30 x 30 room packed with supplies - cots, food (canned and dried), medical supplie books, tools, etc - everything a "survivalist" would stoc for about three months. Sarah is sitting at a small table staring at Burt. She is in her "adult" costume also. Burt scans the room with his eyes, finally coming back to the little boy in the strange outfit who says ecstatically:

dialogues.speaker: JOB
dialogues.text: Isn't it neat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is low in the sky. It will be dusk in less than a hour. Isaac and Malachai are having a heated discussion. Malachai's leg is bleeding through ban-dages. Vicky, now unconscious, is still up on the cross next to The Blue Ma There are about A DOZEN BOYS present. They listen intentl to the argument.  101.

dialogues.speaker: MALACHAL
dialogues.text: The Lord will' be pleased enough with Amos. We need the woman. She will bring the man to us.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: No! He must be taken without her. We cannot remove her from this place. It is Holy!

dialogues.speaker: MALACHAL
dialogues.text: To bring Him two we would not use one?

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: (threatening) Do not blaspheme, MalachaiI You know not the laws. He speaks them only to me.

dialogues.speaker: MALACHAL
dialogues.text: (enraged) I think not, Isaac I You are the one who has lost favor with Him! He is a God of blood and sacrifice, not ceremony!

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: (shouting) Liesl Sacrilege! Down on your knees, heretic! Malachai lashes out with his fist and knocks Isaac to the ground. Malachai stands over him. The new Usurper.

dialogues.speaker: MALACHAL
dialogues.text: Command me not, Isaac, for you have grown prideful, and apart from us. He Who Walks Behind the Rows will decide your fate. Isaac, dripping with venom and utter hatred for Malachai, turns on the assembled group. He screams invectives.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Don't just stand there! Seize him! Punish him! Cut him down! I command you. I am the Word and the Giver of His Laws! (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ISAAC(cont 'd) Disobedience to me is disobedience to Him, He Who Walks Behind the Rows, and He will slay you with a thousand times a thousand deaths each more horrible than the last!!! Isaac's words fall on deaf ears, or at least changed mind The boys gather around Malachai, not to seize him but to accept him as their new leader. Malachai accepts the role matter-of-factly.

dialogues.speaker: MALACHAL
dialogues.text: Cut the woman down. Put Isaac in her place.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: No! You dare not!

dialogues.speaker: MALACHAL
dialogues.text: We will see how he favors you. Isaac is seized and dragged to Vicky's cross.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: No! You blaspheme! He will punish you! The jaws of Hell will devour you. All of you! He struggles violently but in vain. Vicky is cut down fro the cross. Malachai watches with vengeful approval, as Is is put in her place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PROCESSION enters the clearing. It is Amos, followed by his wife and children, escorted by candle bearing Childre the Corn. Amos steps forward, that glazed look in his eye

dialogues.speaker: AMOS
dialogues.text: I'm ready to celebrate my birthday.

dialogues.speaker: MALACHAL
dialogues.text: We have a surprise for you, Amos. Isaac is going to keep you company. Amos, Malachai and the rest look towards the cross.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isaac is on the cross, still kicking, struggling and shouting.  103.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Malachai! He will punish you! He will punish all of you! He will not forgive you. None of you will be forgiven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt is finishing bandaging his shoulder wound with the available medical supplies.

dialogues.speaker: JOB
dialogues.text: My dad built it. For when the Communists launch their first strike. Burt laughs bitterly.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: The Communists aren't going to get us, Job. We're going to get us.

dialogues.speaker: JOB
dialogues.text: Are you looking for the lady?

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: (sharply) Yes! Have you seen her?

dialogues.speaker: JOB
dialogues.text: They took her to the clearing.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: What clearing? Where?

dialogues.speaker: JOB
dialogues.text: In the cornfield. Where The Blue Man is.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: JOB
dialogues.text: I followed them. Just like I followed you.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: Show me. Sarah intercedes with surprising vehemence.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: No! You can't. It's almost night.  104.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Night is His time.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: (frustrated, confused) Whose time? What are you talking about? Sarah hands him a picture from her stack. Burt walks over the table where she's sitting.

dialogues.speaker: THE PICTURE
dialogues.text: It is a picture he, and we, have seen. It shows the figur He Who Walks Behind the Rows, with that caption underneat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands her back the picture.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: I've seen these. In the house. I don't believe there's a bogey-man out there.

dialogues.speaker: JOB
dialogues.text: Is too. He made them kill my mom and dad.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: (sincere) Tell me.

dialogues.speaker: JOB
dialogues.text: I don't remember everything that happened cuz I was only five then, now I'm eight... As he continues, with Burt listening intently, we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night is falling. There's a small glimmer of sun on the horizon, sinking fast. Malachai looks around. He calls ou to his unseen foe.  105.

dialogues.speaker: MALACHAL
dialogues.text: Outlander! We have your woman. She still lives! And indeed she does. CAMERA WIDENS TO INCLUDE VICKY, who bound and in Malachai 's grasp. About TWENTY BOYS are milling about, waiting to do their part if Burt should co

dialogues.speaker: MALACHAL
dialogues.text: (to a group) Five of you, go through the town. Call to him. Tell him we wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Job is finishing telling Burt the story. His words should sound familiar.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: Then it was Malachai who killed the old man at the gas station.

dialogues.speaker: JOB
dialogues.text: Uh huh. I think his name was Mr Diehl, but once I heard Malachai say it was Judas.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: (pleading) Job, you've got to take me to that clearing. I think it was Malachai has taken Vicky, and if I don't get there soon, I'm afraid she's going to wind up like Mr. Diehl. Job ponders very seriously for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: JOB
dialogues.text: Alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malachai is still calling to Burt, baiting him with Vicky

dialogues.speaker: MALACHAL
dialogues.text: Outlander! Maybe you don't hear well. How's this?  106. He pulls the knife across Vicky's face, cutting her cheek She screams.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Burt! Don't.... Malachai clasps a hand over her mouth, muffling her warni

dialogues.speaker: MALACHAL
dialogues.text: Her blood will spill, Outlander Unless you give yourself up unto Him.

dialogues.speaker: BURT, JOB
dialogues.text: The three emerge from the bomb shelter and begin running towards the corn. They cross the street and run to where field is visible. Something jerks Burt to a sudden halt.

dialogues.speaker: BURT'S POV
dialogues.text: In the distance, near the barn by the cornfield, Malachai still holding Vicky.

dialogues.speaker: MALACHAL
dialogues.text: We won't wait much longer, Outlander! It is coming Night, and Night is His time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt has to resist the temptation to run directly to Vick aid. Job and Sarah now see what he is looking at.

dialogues.speaker: JOB
dialogues.text: (hissing) Malachai! (then childlike) He's in trouble now....

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: Job, you and Sarah find a place to hide. If anything happens to me, you head out of town as fast as you can. Stay on the road, and don't stop until you reach Hemingford. Now go on. Burt hasn't stopped looking at Vicky the whole time. He r OFF SCREEN, leaving Job and Sarah watching him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night comes, and night is His time. The corn begins to rustle until it actually seems to tremble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He Who Walks Behind the Rows is on the move, casting a bl shadow against the blackening sky. The corn bends to His will, flattening on all sides as the God surges forward.

dialogues.speaker: THE CLEARING
dialogues.text: Isaac, from his high vantage point, sees what's happening the corn. Terror fills his face.

dialogues.speaker: AMOS
dialogues.text: Amos has been sitting cross-legged in the clearing. Waiti Staring off into a private place. He senses the approachi force and stands up. He is smiling.

dialogues.speaker: AMOS
dialogues.text: It's Him. He's come for me. He's come to welcome me. He looks into the sky, all about, but cannot see any-thin Searching, he wanders out of the clearing and into the ro His calling fades in the wind.

dialogues.speaker: AMOS
dialogues.text: I am here, Lord. I'm ready!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whimpering and cowering like the 14- year old boy that he Isaac watches as Amos disappears into the corn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An eerie wind is beginning to blow, somewhat like the win the outer edge of the eye of the storm, which signals the of the calm and the beginning of the apocalypse. In the BACKGROUND, the corn is breezing wildly. Debris, tumblewe parts of corn plants, etc, are blowing across Gatlin.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: He is creeping up on Malachai with quick bursts of speed cover to cover.  108. He runs from the back of A HOUSE to A FIXTURE OF PIPES AN TUBING that leads out into the cornfield.

dialogues.speaker: THE FIXTURE
dialogues.text: There's a CEMENT APRON around the fixture, and a removabl COVER in the cement. Some WHITE LETTERING has been painte on the side of one of the pipes: SPRINKLER PUMPS #5 AND # Burt looks out to where the tubing leads and sees....

dialogues.speaker: THE CORNFIELD
dialogues.text: Even in the dark, he can make out the shape of TwO GIANT SPRINKLERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is some HOSE and TUBING lying around the fixture. B picks up a length of the metal tubing and hefts it in his hand. He looks at Malachai differently now. Not more than feet separates them.

dialogues.speaker: BURT, INCLUDING MALACHAI
dialogues.text: Before Burt can make his move, A NOISE from the corn-fiel distracts everybody. All heads turn towards it. They can nothing, only hear A SCREAM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isaac is ashen and sweating. His eyes are filled with unspeakable horror as he listens to the sound of Amos screaming just beyond him in the corn. That area of the c is being torn up by something tremendous. There are terri beastly howls around Amos' feeble screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SOUND OF TEARING AND BREAKING, followed by a GURGLING, quiets that area of the corn momentarily. Isaac waits and listens, straining to see. Suddenly, something is heaved into the clearing from the field. It looks like a sack, o what might once have been a body. It is wearing the remna of Amos' clothes. As it lands in a heap, it splatters blo on Isaac.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shadow, visible even in the dark because it is blacker the night, falls over Isaac. He is looking straight up at something immense. He begs and pleads with it like a chil  109.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: I...I did as you commanded...I was good...I swear it... His eyes widen further, if that is possible, as the shado descends upon him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even more wind now, almost a gale. There is a single, gia death cloud over Gatlin. Burt uses the oppor-tunity to attack. Malachai and the others are so preoccupied with what's going on out in the cornfield that they've allowed themselves to be caught off guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicky sees Burt charging. She jerks her body around so th Malachai’s back is turned into Burt. Burt slugs him with pipe and butts him with his good shoulder. Malachai spraw to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: BURT
dialogues.text: (to Vicky) Run!

dialogues.speaker: THE FIFE FIXTURE
dialogues.text: Job and Sarah have been trailing Burt. They run from the back of the same house he did to the same sprinkler fixtu They watch excitedly as he takes on Malachai.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicky has run to the barn. Burt is trying to catch up to but the circle of boys has closed around him. He lashes o with the pipe, scattering some of them in front, but sudd his knees go out from under him as Malachai tackles him f behind. They roll in the dirt, Malachai pressing down wit his knife while Burt tries to resist him with his left, h The boys do not intercede, sensing this is Malachai's fig They are also a bit intimidated by Burt. He's the first "man" many of them have had to deal with in some time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt bucks Malachai with his leg, giving himself-;just en time and room to swat him across the face with the pipe.  110. Malachai goes over on his back and Burt is instantly on t of him.
